channel.title: pfSense & VMware vSphere & Importing
channel.description:
Hi,
My setup is as follows:
VM Network -> Firewall -> Internal VM network (All VM's should be connected to this, but NOT including Whomix instances.) Internal VM Network <- Firewall <- Whomix network (Whomix gateway should be between Whoamix network and Firewall.)
My question is that how should I import the instances?

item.title: pfSense & VMware vSphere & Importing
item.dc:creator: samip537
item.description:
[quote=“Patrick, post:2, topic:1267”]VMware is unsupported. (https://www.whonix.org/wiki/FAQ#What_do_you_mean_by_unsupported.3F)

VMware documentation stub:

Whonix

VMware

Using Whonix with VMware

It’s Whonix, not Whomix.

Check out if this thread is any help:
https://www.whonix.org/forum/index.php?topic=508.0

mirimir wrote this guide (haven’t completely read it or tested it myself). “Part 8 – Creating Nested Chains of VPNs and Tor”:
https://www.ivpn.net/privacy-guides/advanced-privacy-and-anonymity-part-8

mirimir might know how to set this up.[/quote]

So basically it should work. Then I shall test.

Read full topic

item.title: pfSense & VMware vSphere & Importing
item.dc:creator: samip537
item.description:
Hi,

My setup is as follows:

VM Network → Firewall → Internal VM network (All VM’s should be connected to this, but NOT including Whomix instances.)
Internal VM Network ← Firewall ← Whomix network (Whomix gateway should be between Whoamix network and Firewall.)

My question is that how should I import the instances?

Read full topic
